page.title: 16WETHERBY LORRY PARK
page.content: The Wetherby lorry park is a popular overnight stopping point for lorry drivers. A recent survey revealed the following figures:Monday (37 lorries), Tuesday(39),Wednesday(33),Thursday(51) Friday(43),Saturday(11) and Sunday(9) giving an average of 32. Early in the week the average is 38 but towards the end of the working week this increaes to 47. At the weekend the numbers decrease, especially on Sunday. The lorry park seems to be a perfect stopping-off point between the north and south of Britain. Seventy per cent of the lorries were north-east based (mainly from Ashington, Tynemouth, Stockton-on-Tees, and Newcastle). Some lorries did come from south of Wetherby (Salisbury and Coventry). At the weekend the lorries remaining were either Wetherby based drivers, or local companies e.g. George Moores.
